intro: Clavulium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and showy, umbellate inflorescences. The leaves are typically basal, with a broad, lanceolate shape and a hairy surface. Clavulium species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in moist, woodland habitats. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that develop into dry, three-lobed capsules containing numerous seeds.
